paper_abstract: This paper introduces a novel monitoring trail (m-trail) allocation method for achieving local unambiguous failure localization under the monitoring burst (m-burst) framework, in which a single monitoring node (MN) can localize any multi-link failure with up to d links in a (d + 1)-connected network by inspecting the optical bursts traversing through it. Specifically, the proposed m-trail allocation method ensures that any healthy link is traversed by at least one uninterrupted m-trail during a multi-link failure, which can be achieved by launching no more than (d + 1) link-disjoint m-trails per link originating from the MN. Based on such a sufficient condition, we study the performance of the m-burst framework by solving an integer linear program (ILP) and a novel heuristic, and implement the method for up to three link failures. To avoid high computation complexity in solving the ILP, a heuristic algorithm is developed for deriving (d + 1) link-disjoint m-trails between the MN and each link of the network. Numerical results show that the proposed methods yield significantly better performance than previous methods in the reference backbone network topologies.
paper_title: Multi-link Failure Localization via Monitoring Bursts
